pros: Worthy cause- supporting children's mental health, lots of autonomy in role, fantastic team, hybrid working.
cons: It is sometimes difficult to know how to progress from the coordinator role

job_title: Mental Health Practitioner in Coventry, England
pros: Great team, supportive, positive environment and focused on the work with children
cons: Can be hard to integrate with schools and often working alone and team is spread across the country

job_title: Mental Health Practitioner in Manchester, England
pros: Great place to begin as a counsellor working with young people.
cons: Not much opportunity to move up.

review_title: Hope that your face fits or see you later
pros: Fantastic cause and really helps young people
cons: If your face doesn't fit they will make sure you're not there long

job_title: Head of Communications in London, England
pros:
- Supportive, approachable senior leadership / Executive team. Reciprocal mentoring scheme sees senior leaders mentor / be mentored by colleagues.
- Opportunities for learning and development.
- Committed to staff progression - I joined as Communications Officer in 2019, was quickly made Comms Manager, and was more recently promoted to Head of Comms. Where new roles not available, opportunities are given through apprenticeships, mentoring, training etc.
- Dedicated to Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion - with steering groups (an EDI group, a Plus+ Group for LGBTQ+ colleagues, and a new group for those with hearing impairments). 
- Lots of opportunities to connect with the 'frontline' - school visits, all staff meetings. A good reminder of why we do what we do.
- Feel like you're making a difference.
- Flexible / hybrid working - able to split time between home and office which allows for better work life balance.
cons:
- Workload can be high at times.
- Staff benefits could be improved.
- In more junior roles, salary could be improved (though seems on par with wider charity sector, from my experience).

review_title: Great place to work, dedicated staff
pros: Making a difference in children’s lives, good community of like minded people
cons: Pay could be vastly improved

pros: rewarding, and large organisation to work for
cons: Alot of department, and high turnover

pros: I recently joined Place 2 Be and I can't speak highly enough of their induction process and how valuable I feel as an employee. The organisational truly lives its values and offers opportunity to have open dialogue with colleagues across teams, opportunities to meet with Exec Team and promotes collaboration and inclusivity. I feel Place 2 Be value their staff and care about their professional progression and personal life !
cons: Can't note any to date - my induction has been wonderful!

pros: Absolutely brilliant service, highly recommend
cons: no downsides in the experience

job_title: School Project Manager in London, England
pros:
The privilege to work with children and families in a meaningful way.
Being in supportive and welcoming teams of colleagues going through similar things.
cons:
I worked for Place2Be for almost 7 years before feeling driven out by constantly changing policies, teams and managers.

The clinical delivery model has been changed with 0 consultation of staff to something that serves only business plans and data collection, not children needing therapy. This has been challenging to implement and caused big rifts and distress to staff and schools alike.

Should a school have to exit if they can no longer afford the service, SPMs have to interview for a new contract and be put at the start of the pay scale regardless of how long they have previously been in post. Compared to similar roles in other schools / organisations with similar responsibilities the pay at either end is incredibly low. 

Management is generally unsupportive and supervision often feels punitive as SPMs have to argue for children to have more time in therapy and the children themselves get pushed aside.

Burnout is very real, with school based staff expected to cram in a weeks worth of work in two or three days. Despite the stated emphasis on self care, this does not translate into action and presenteeism is rife.

A large number of staff who have been with the organisation for years have been leaving, as evidenced by the constant emails advertising vacancies.

job_title: People & Culture Advisor in London, England
pros: Great company culture, everyone is so kind, fabulous supportive team and everyone is so welcoming. Flexible working, great opportunities to learn new skills. The name speaks for itself.
cons: Perks and benefits provided to employees could improve.

pros:
working with children and yp
great clinical experience gained
supervising trainee counsellers
working in schools

overworked
changing goal posts
disloyal practices

review_title: Passionate team focused on improving children's mental health
job_title: Head of Communications in London, England
pros:
*Passionate and supportive colleagues across all parts of the UK

cons: *At times, workloads can be heavy to match big ambitions to support more children and young people

pros: great place to start your career

Not much for progression 
Things seem messy and not proper processes in place

review_title: A fantastic children's mental health charity
pros:
- Working to help improve children's mental health and wellbeing, a cause that is very relevant and important. 
- A very rewarding and purposeful job.
- Great company culture, with everyone kind and supportive.
- Flexible hybrid working
- Opportunity to learn new skills and strengthen existing skills.
cons:
- Salary is lower than what other organisations pay in the similar roles.
- Limited career progression

review_title: I wish I had had the confidence to have left sooner.
job_title: Office Based Staff in London, England
pros:
There are some lovely people.
Some teams are lovely to work in. 
What Place2Be do as an orgnsiation is wonderful - they really are making the world a better place.
cons:
My experience at Place2Be was that I repeatedly raised concerns regarding line management, place within the wider organization, working hours, how the department structure did not work etc. and nothing ever came of it. My line manger was pretty forgetful, disinterested (borderline incompetent) and ultimately shielded by his position. My experience with HR was that they either fobbed you off or ignored you. 

I wish I had had the confidence to have left sooner. 

Place2Be are making changes within the people department now, as they recognise there is a problem, but it's a little too late. Some 'bad apples' have gone and spoiled the barrel. I predict there will be a lot of people leaving Place2Be in the coming months.

pros:
Good training, HR support and organisation. Good management structure and well supported staff.
Excellent clinical company.
cons: Expensive provider of counselling in schools but provide high end service

review_title: Well intended organisation that's lost its way
job_title: School Project Manager in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: Some fantastic staff working on the frontline; well-intentioned organisation that helps children; accessible CEO; enhanced holidays.
cons: Organisation has completely changed its clinical model to one more economic and psychology based. In-house training very much about giving 'expert' information rather than teaching/sharing the art of therapy and listening. Staff are worked harder than ever before, are micro-managed under the guise of clinical supervision and there is subsequently a high staff turn-over...

job_title: School Project Manager in London, England
pros: Induction support and training was great, and all staff are very supportive
cons: IT was a let down initially, equipment delays, login etc which made it more difficult in terms of starting a brand new role

pros: Lots of great training and opportunities
cons: I am still waiting to start as a Bank staff

pros: In school and proactively accessing clients in need

pros: Committed SLT, passionate colleagues, making a difference for children. At the heart of the sector with growing influence.
cons: Can be pressured. Good progress with issues around diversity and inclusion but more to be done.

job_title: School Project Manager in London, England
pros:
Good learning curve. 
Management and supervisor experience. 
Working with children
cons:
- Changing goalposts
- Project managers are often expected to cram 5 days work into 2 or 3 days. 
- Manager and Supervisor are the same person
- Low pay
- Volunteer Trainee counsellors - the majority of counsellors are trainees and volunteers. Even thought counsellors are the backbone of the organisations the majority of them are not paid.
- In-house training does not offer progressive learning (basic)
- The Organisation does not support the well being of staff
- Limited benefits
- Lack of development

pros: A purposeful organisation with a skilled workforce.
cons: Has become a bit unsettled.

job_title: School Project Manager in Glasgow, Scotland
pros: Supportive management and great team environment

job_title: Mental Health Practitioner in Manchester, England
pros: The team, working with young people and families
cons: None I can think of

pros:
Place2Be does amazing work with young people in schools and it's great to feel a part of that.
There are some inspirational people who work at the organisation.
I learnt a lot whilst I was in post. My role was varied and I never felt bored.
cons:
To try to solve problems, new roles are often created, generally with high salaries. These roles are often not well thought out and so end up being unsuccessful. More junior staff are not consulted about the new roles or encouraged to apply. This has resulted in staff feeling undervalued. 
The salaries at head office do not feel fair with some people being paid more than others with less responsibilities and accountability.
Staff turnover at head office is high at all levels which is unsettling.
Although the facilities are better at the new office, the atmosphere feels much more corporate and Place2Be has lost the family, friendly feel it once had.

job_title: School Project Manager in Glasgow, Scotland
pros:
This is one of my employers who added value to myself as a person and professionally. My managers were extremely supportive and I had lots of relevant and high quality valuable training. A place where my ethnicity, religion or race was not a barrier; it was truly a Place2Be.
My managers were always handy for emergency supervision and will go the extra mile to provide needed support in delivering the service stressless-ly.  
The support within the team was priceless.  My colleagues were readily available to share best practice and suggestions which made the job a very enjoyable one indeed.  I was never alone and never felt alienated. A Place where my voice mattered, was not dismissed and distrusted.
cons: The only downside with working outside London with Place2Be is travelling to some training and events during school term time.

job_title: School Project Manager in London, England
pros:
Firstly, it is important to acknowledge how vital the organisation is and how impactful the workers are. Therefore, working with Place2Be can be very fulfilling if you are passionate about the job role.
The company promotes equal opportunities through its diverse workforce. 
Inexperienced employees (such as School project managers) tend to be supported by cluster managers that have a wealth of experience, which can be reassuring. 
The company provides essential training to enable professional and personal development.
A sense of community among fellow staff (
Lastly, the working hours of a school project manager can be beneficial to someone seeking to work minimal hours.
cons: The training provided could be more robust and progressive. Some of the workshops provided for are short, rushed and overloaded.

job_title: SPM in Salford, North West England, England
pros:
I have been part of the Place2Be family since 2017.  I use the word family as my personal experience has been warm and supportive, have not yet met anyone who has not been.
The training opportunities are many and of high quality.
The work as an SPM is varied and fulfilling, it can be a struggle to juggle all elements of the role, but with focus and organisation it is manageable.
cons: The SPM role is funded by schools buying in the service, and even if they want to keep the service, this is not always a financial possibility, making job security uncertain. Place2Be try to be supportive in this situation but ultimately it can be challenging.

review_title: A lack of team work and an ethos of blame
pros: You won't break a sweat working for this organisation. You are autonomous in your role to an extent.
cons: They promise career progression and training on their website and in the interview but if you are in head office there is no training and no career progression. You are expected to get on with your job with no guidance (just management delegating). There is a strong ethos of pointing the finger of blame. No real element of teamwork.

pros: Place2Be is a respectable charity with long history that is supporting hundreds of schools all over UK. I am proud to be a part of Place2Be family. I enjoy my role and responsibility and feel that I am providing emotional support to many families.
cons: As I started working on a new project, it seemed challenging to manage school's expectations, space etc. I had to start working on different areas prior training and I would feel more supported if space and school's expectations would be negotiated and met before I started my work at school.

pros:
The best placement for experience with working with children, Place2be was more than a placement for me i have learnt more than i ever imagined.
Being around such an amazing team of people really makes you feel part of something special. 
The only placement i can say that give back through courses and training which makes it worth well worth volunteering.
cons: I have never had a negative experience within Place2be

job_title: School Project Manager in London, England
pros: It can provide a friendly and supportive community of colleagues.
cons: The role of SPM is irresponsibly packed with an array of different duties. It is a role for 2-3 people in one, often squeezed into 1-2 days per week. Such a senior and important role should be simplified in order to give the employee time to think and process their work, all that is crucial for the delivery of quality and safe counselling and psychotherapy. In addition it is poorly paid for the amount of work expected.

job_title: School Project Manager in Salford, North West England, England
pros: I think children's mental health is important and Place2be offer an excellent level of support to schools. The training provided by the organisation is outstanding. I have only been with Place2be for a short time but I am excited about what the role has in store for me.
cons: The only downside I can think of so far is that most of the training is in London. More regional training would be a bonus.

pros: Nice work culture, office is friendly.
cons: I felt that my manager had it in for me from the beginning, so I had to start recording my conversations with them so I could go to HR. I eventually left because of it.

review_title: Positive work environment and great outcomes for children
pros: Great induction process and welcoming environment, working in a newly renovated, fit for purpose office (core). Working for a fantastic cause with great outcomes for children, surrounded by colleagues with a wealth of expertise in the children's mental health sector.
cons: The usual issues with working in a large organisation with lots of sites - it's difficult to get to know and connect with people who are working in different areas

review_title: Overall good organisation to work for
pros:
Enhanced annual leave entitlement
Good working relationships with colleagues in my team
A clear career path for counsellors who are interested in the work that Place2Be does
cons: A bit of a disconnect between field staff and employees at head office

job_title: School Project Manager in London, England
pros:
You learn from a great team
There is access to some good in-house training
The level of management and expertise in-house is inspiring
Working with children, you can see the difference you make
It's a developing company and their model works, in its containing and therapeutic approach
cons: The work is not remunerated at a level that reflects the skills

pros: Place2Be has been supportive in allowing me to pursue and access training essential to my role and personal development.
cons: The organisation has experienced exponential growth in the last couple of years, putting pressure on its resources.

cons: New job roles that have been introduced can sometimes take time to be established, which can be particularly challenging in a school environment that have particular expectations.

pros: Able to see the direct link with the work of Place2Be and the impact on children's mental health in schools. Twice monthly supervision is a really appreciated.
cons: Busy workload but feel the organisation really cares about its staff.

cons: Work load is overwhelmed with different responsibilities and expectations. It made it very difficult to manage and contain the role. Likely chance of woking overtime as a result which disrupts work-life balance.
